text:
Hello <@U015D5GCWKE>, thanks for flagging this with us. I added a <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Call-dispositions-API-endpoint-doesn-t-return-correct-list-of/m-p/342337#M33472|response> on your community post just now.

Right now, this is expected behaviour. The <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/engagements/get-call-dispositions|Get call engagement endpoint> doesn't return custom outcomes but it is something we are planning to add in the future.

Hi, first time posting here. I am trying to access a form submission's custom field ( from a form created through HubSpot GUI) but I do not see it appear in the form-submissions from the Get Contact by VID API.

All I get is this:
```"form-submissions": [
        {
            "conversion-id": "33060445-c206-4df0-8f49-fca81414781d",
            "timestamp": 1591734772713,
            "form-id": "4a62614f-96c0-450a-8ab2-fe2601339883",
            "portal-id": 6255960,
            "page-url": "<https://fake.com/resources/webinars/fake-name>",
            "page-title": "Webinar: Boost your Global Business Management Platform with CRM | Fake Company",
            "title": "Fake Website - Webinars - Boost Your Global Business Management Platform with CRM ",
            "form-type": "HubSpot",
            "contact-associated-by": [
                "EMAIL"
            ],
            "meta-data": []
        },```
I would expect the field "comment" I created to appear here.

Could anyone please help me?

Is there any additional documentation on the new v3 Import API? Specifically looking for the possible values that could be returned for `importNotificationType` and also interested in knowing about the different metadata details that can be provided

We have a lot of logic built into the "Contact List" feature, but instead of pulling the data with an hourly cron, I'd like to just wait for a webhook and then pull the data from a list, otherwise I would need to recreate all of the HubSpot logic within my software.
It looks like access to `lists` isn't available through the app webhook, but it seems to be through the workflow.
Can anybody provide any guidance? For example, I want a webhook when a contact is added to a list.
Ok, I'm using a Workflow with an aggregate of lists to send a webhook. That works.
I'm not thinking this is possible, there isn't really email coming into HubSpot....

<@U015D5GCWKE> "Note: Files that contain sensitive or confidential information should not be uploaded to file manager, as all uploaded files are stored on a public CDN where the files can be accessed by anyone with the file URL."

Our files contain sensitive information. We cannot have it on a public CDN unfortunately. Thanks for your time.

“Files uploaded with the optional parameter hidden set to true will be inaccessible via the file manager or the URLs returned in the response. The hidden parameter is intended for files that are attached to engagements.”
I don’t think they are on a public cdn when hidden. But I don’t insist :)

Hello. Just to be clear: we can communicate with the Hubspost API only from external scripts (python, js, etc.) on another server? With Hubl, we just have functions, tags, etc. and we cannot directly talk with the API. Am I right?
